Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk net-snmp
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk net-snmp-agent-libs
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: net-snmp bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The net-snmp packages provide various libraries and tools for the Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP), including an SNMP library, an extensible agent, tools for requesting or setting information from SNMP agents, tools for generating and handling SNMP traps, a version of the netstat command which uses SNMP, and a Tk/Perl Management Information Base (MIB) browser. This update fixes the following bugs: The SNMP daemon (snmpd) can optionally ignore remote file systems to speed up the reporting of storage-related statistics by setting the "skipNFSInHostResources" option in the snmpd.conf file to "1". Prior to this update, net-snmp did not ignore the MultiVersion File System (MVFS) with this configuration. Consequently, when snmpd ran on a system with an MVFS mounted, snmpd had to wait for remote storage information or network timeouts when gathering storage-related information. The net-snmp packages have been updated to ignore MVFS in the described situation, and the negative impact on the snmpd performance no longer occurs. (BZ#1086606) Previously, snmpd did not expect that two or more entries with the same destination and the same gateway addresses can be present in a network routing table and did not check for duplicates in the "IP-FORWARD-MIB::ipCidrRouteTable" object. This could cause snmpd to send an incorrect reply to the GETNEXT requests in "IP-FORWARD-MIB::ipCidrRouteTable", as it returned the same object instead of returning the next object. Consequently, the system displayed the "Error: OID not increasing" message after using the snmpwalk utility to read "IP-FORWARD-MIB::ipCidrRouteTable". This update modifies snmpd to check for duplicates in "IP-FORWARD-MIB::ipCidrRouteTable", and snmpd now returns the next object in the described situation. (BZ#1172013) The "clientaddr" and "clientaddrUsesPort" configuration options allow the system administrator to set a specific port for outgoing SNMP requests. Previously, when the port number could not be used, SNMP tools and daemons did not report this and instead assigned a random port for the outgoing request. As a consequence, net-snmp sent the SNMP requests from unexpected ports, and the system administrator was not informed about this. This update modifies net-snmp to report the error in the described situation, and the system administrator is now informed that the requested port cannot be used. (BZ#1086925) Previously, when an object identifier (OID) was out of the subtree registered by the proxy statement in the /etc/snmp/snmpd.conf file, snmpd failed to use a correct OID of proxied GETNEXT requests. With this update, snmpd adjusts the OIDs of proxied GETNEXT requests correctly and sends appropriate requests to the remote agent as expected. (BZ#1087801) Previously, the net-snmp-python subpackage contained a generic net-snmp readme file. With this update, net-snmp-python provides a readme file related to the Net-SNMP Python module. (BZ#1158391) Previously, snmpd did not expect that the CPU number can have more than two digits. As a consequence, snmpd did not show more than 100 processors in the "HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrProcessorTable" object when reading CPU statistics. With this update, snmpd has been modified to no longer make assumptions about the CPU ID length. As a result, "HOST-RESOURCES-MIB::hrProcessorTable" now shows all CPUs. (BZ#1070076) Users of net-snmp are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
